content: Thank you for clarifying this. It has been my assumption based on what information I managed to gather since the "announcement" but was never explicitly stated.

author: deme1744
content:
Yes, I understand that, and mentioned something similar here (https://discord.com/channels/890617081744220180/890617082243350560/1382709225582628965). I'm not sure yet if we want to keep Portal version of the beacon network around. The post-merge proofs for headers do rely on BeaconState's historical_summaries proof though. But this can be requested via beacon REST API (for Nimbus at least, not standardized currently) and as you mentioned, the headers aren't required for EL. I would prefer not to slim down Portal history further by dropping those though, but there would be some difficulty in generating these proofs, from an EL PoV.
And yes, having ELs as node injecting the data was always the long term idea. But it was never pushed for/relied on for/until now.

author: deme1744
content: A group call would definitely be useful with the interested parties to understand how we scope best what Portal should still contain.

author: deme1744
content:
In your first point you mention that Portal implementations will not be maintained. But those teams also did most of the research for Portal, not just the implementation. I assume this means any research on this will be stopped? By extension, does that mean that no research in general will be supported (for now?) on providing state for future stateless clients (whichever future of statelessness is selected)?

I noticed this answer related to this: https://nitter.poast.org/tkstanczak/status/1932946876556341483
Which acknowledges a need for this, but at the same time also completely avoids confirming or denying that anything will be done for it. Just "rethinking". A rather unsatisfying answer imo.

author: ktl_xv
content: Glados relies on eth-portal-api which is developed together with Trin. Not sure if this library will continue being updated without Trin.
